com.diffplug.common.tree

Class TreeQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.diffplug.common.tree.TreeQuery

  • public final class TreeQuery
extends Object

    Queries against TreeDef trees, such as lowest common ancestor, list of parents, etc.

    • Method Summary

      CopyType      		 copyLeavesIn(TreeDef<T> def, T root, BiFunction<T,List<CopyType>,CopyType> nodeMapper)
      Copies the given tree of T to CopyType, starting at the leaf nodes of the tree and moving in to the root node, which allows CopyType to be immutable (but does not require it).

      Copies the given tree of T to CopyType, starting at the root node of the tree and moving out to the leaf nodes, which generally requires CopyType to be mutable (if you want CopyType nodes to know who their children are).

        Returns true iff child is a descendant of parent, or if child is equal to parent.

        Returns the root of the given tree.

      • toRoot

        public static <T> List<T> toRoot(TreeDef.Parented<T> treeDef,
                                 T node)

        Creates a mutable list whose first element is node, and last element is its root parent.

      • copyLeavesIn

        public static <T,CopyType> CopyType copyLeavesIn(TreeDef<T> def,
                                                 T root,
                                                 BiFunction<T,List<CopyType>,CopyType> nodeMapper)

        Copies the given tree of T to CopyType, starting at the leaf nodes of the tree and moving in to the root node, which allows CopyType to be immutable (but does not require it).

        Parameters:
        def - defines the structure of the tree
        root - root of the tree
        nodeMapper - given an unmapped node, and a list of CopyType nodes which have already been mapped, return a mapped node.
        Returns:
        a CopyType with the same contents as the source tree

      • copyRootOut

        public static <T,CopyType> CopyType copyRootOut(TreeDef<T> def,
                                                T root,
                                                BiFunction<T,CopyType,CopyType> mapper)

        Copies the given tree of T to CopyType, starting at the root node of the tree and moving out to the leaf nodes, which generally requires CopyType to be mutable (if you want CopyType nodes to know who their children are).

        Parameters:
        def - defines the structure of the tree
        root - root of the tree
        nodeMapper - given an unmapped node, and a parent CopyType which has already been mapped, return a mapped node. This function must have the side effect that the returned node should be added as a child of its parent node.
        Returns:
        a CopyType with the same contents as the source tree

      • toParent

        public static <T> List<T> toParent(TreeDef.Parented<T> treeDef,
                                   T node,
                                   T parent)

        Creates a mutable list whose first element is node, and last element is parent.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if parent is not a parent of node

      • lowestCommonAncestor

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> Optional<T> lowestCommonAncestor(TreeDef.Parented<T> treeDef,
                                                                T... nodes)

        Returns the common parent of N elements.

      • lowestCommonAncestor

        public static <T> Optional<T> lowestCommonAncestor(TreeDef.Parented<T> treeDef,
                                                   List<T> nodes)

        Returns the common parent of N elements.

      • path

        public static <T> String path(TreeDef.Parented<T> treeDef,
                              T node,
                              Function<? super T,String> toString,
                              String delimiter)

        Returns the path of the given node.

        Parameters:
        treeDef - the treeDef
        node - the root of the tree
        toString - a function to map each node to a string in the path
        delimiter - a string to use as a path separator

      • path

        public static <T> String path(TreeDef.Parented<T> treeDef,
                              T node,
                              Function<? super T,String> toString)

        Returns the path of the given node, using / as the path delimiter.

        See Also:
        path(com.diffplug.common.tree.TreeDef.Parented, Object, Function, String)

      • path

        public static <T> String path(TreeDef.Parented<T> treeDef,
                              T node)

        Returns the path of the given node, using / as the path delimiter and Object.toString() as the mapping function.

        See Also:
        path(com.diffplug.common.tree.TreeDef.Parented, Object, Function, String)

      • findByPath

        public static <T,P> Optional<T> findByPath(TreeDef<T> treeDef,
                                           T node,
                                           List<P> path,
                                           BiPredicate<T,P> equality)

        Finds a child TreeNode based on its path.

        Searches the child nodes for the first element, then that node’s children for the second element, etc.

        Parameters:
        treeDef - defines a tree
        node - starting point for the search
        path - the path of nodes which we’re looking
        equality - a function for determining equality between the tree nodes and the path elements

      • findByPath

        public static <T,P> Optional<T> findByPath(TreeDef<T> treeDef,
                                           T node,
                                           Function<? super T,?> treeMapper,
                                           List<P> path,
                                           Function<? super P,?> pathMapper)

        Finds a child TreeNode based on its path.

        Searches the child nodes for the first element, then that node’s children for the second element, etc.

        Parameters:
        treeDef - defines a tree
        node - starting point for the search
        treeMapper - maps elements in the tree to some value for comparison with the path elements
        path - the path of nodes which we’re looking
        pathMapper - maps elements in the path to some value for comparison with the tree elements

      • findByPath

        public static <T> Optional<T> findByPath(TreeDef<T> treeDef,
                                         T node,
                                         List<T> path,
                                         Function<? super T,?> mapper)

        Finds a child TreeNode based on its path.

        Searches the child nodes for the first element, then that node’s children for the second element, etc.

        Parameters:
        treeDef - defines a tree
        node - starting point for the search
        path - the path of nodes which we’re looking
        mapper - maps elements to some value for comparison between the tree and the path

      • toString

        public static <T> String toString(TreeDef<T> treeDef,
                                  T root)

        Converts the entire tree into a string-based representation.

        See Also:
        toString(TreeDef, Object, Function, String)

      • toString

        public static <T> String toString(TreeDef<T> treeDef,
                                  T root,
                                  Function<? super T,String> toString)

        Converts the entire tree into a string-based representation.

        See Also:
        toString(TreeDef, Object, Function, String)

      • toString

        public static <T> String toString(TreeDef<T> treeDef,
                                  T root,
                                  Function<? super T,String> toString,
                                  String indent)

        Converts the entire tree into a string-based representation.

        Parameters:
        treeDef - the treeDef
        root - the root of the tree
        toString - the function which generates the name for each node in the tree
        indent - the string to use for each level of indentation
